abstract: Italian Parliament approves law recognizing civil unions of same-sex couples; approval is historic given fact country continues to be dominated by Roman Catholic Church, and is victory for Prime Min Matteo Renzi, who supported bill.

headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Civil Unions Gain Approval in Italy

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

snippet: The law, opposed by the Vatican, stops short of gay marriage but brings Italy more in line with other Western European countries.
lead_paragraph: The law, opposed by the Vatican, stops short of gay marriage but brings Italy more in line with other Western European countries.
